data.title: Delicious Mexican Food with great service!
data.text: I just moved to the Inland Empire; specifically Riverside and I could not any decent and close places for some great Mexicanfood. I stumbled upon Pepitos and loved their great service especially a server named Rosie; she is the absolute best with a friendly and energetic personality. She definitely took care of us. I had some carne asada tacos and tried the carne asada steak with chimichurri and it was the absolute best that I have eaten in a while. The steak was absolutely moist, tasty and made exactly how I ordered it. I recommend it to anyone in the neighborhood as I now go there at least twice a month. Delicious and yes....... Great margaritas!

data.title: What Happened, Pepitos?
data.text:
There are so many Mexican restaurants in the Riverside area, but Pepitos has been one of our long time favorites.  We would eat there at least once a month, and the enchiladas, flautas, fajitas and beans and rice were always spot on.  

We were always greeted immediately and shown to our seats where (just seconds later), our chips and salsa arrived.

In the past year, however, we noticed that along with a new outside sign, there is new personnel, and while friendly, the service has seemed to suffer.  It's okay not to see the regular team, but disappointing to experience longer waits for the arrival of our food.  

Unfortunately,  our most recent experience may have been our last, and that makes me sad.  Our orders were promptly taken, but we had quite a wait for the server to bring us our food.  The bigger problem, however, is that our food was not hot (and therefore must have been sitting on the counter too long while our server was busy cleaning up after a large party).  And....  I also need to add....  what happened to Pepito's rice recipe?  That once delicious flavor is gone. 

Yes, things have definitely changed in our once go-to Mexican restaurant.  Too bad.  I will miss it.

data.title: In Search of the DF or Oaxaca
data.text:
Part of being a southern Californian is Mexican food, from the moles of Oaxaca, Baja seafood, street tacos, all accompanied by the best range of beers,outside of Germany.

Riverside lately has challenged me lately with the closing of La Villa and Las Cascadas in recent years. I have revisited the twice transplanted Zacatecas, which grabbed me in the late 60's with the Special burrito served wet, chile Colorado smothered in melted cheese.  I'm going to visit their new location at an old Shakey's at University @ Iowa, but recently the food has been uneven.

Personally this leaves me with Pepitos which can be pricey,but has good camarones dishes,and Luna in Corona.  Luna has a sophisticated menu, strong on Mole dishes and an upscale my explorations will continue but I may visit Los Angeles more often.

data.title: Oldy & Goody
data.text:
I hadn't been to Pepito's in years so I called up the old fellas who used to meet us and off we went. It was a Friday night but the wait was only 10 minutes. It's a small little spot next to the musical instruments store so it's kind of hidden. The parking has gotten better for the area which is much appreciated because years ago it very limited. 

We ordered the shrimp and steak fajitas just like old times which were still delicious! We also ordered the grande Cadillac Margarita "mas fuerte". The waiters check on you frequently which is good. 

We got there around 8pm and stayed til about 11pm when the place had kind of cleared out. One day we will have to check out the adjoining room where the music and bar are located. 

There place has about 12 booths and maybe about 5-ish tables plus one long table for large parties of 16 people. There's also an outside patio area with a few more tables and room for a big party as well. 

Very good spot to enjoy, eat, talk, and have a great time.

data.title: Good Mexican
data.text: I enjoyed a nice lunch here with family.  The food was good but the service was a little off, and I thought it was fairly spendy.  I enjoyed it though and would go back...that is the bottom line, isn't it?

data.title: Good Place for Lunch
data.text:
Food is good.  I had the bacon wrapped shrimp, Michal had the Burrito with Carnitas.  Both tasty and worth the money.  The service was good.  Our waitress made sure our iced teas were kept full and that we were happy with our food.  

If the physical plant matched the food and service this would be great.  Unfortunately, the interior and exterior look tired.  Parking is difficult to find.  The rear entrance (off the small parking lot) feels like a back, service door.  The music from the bar is loud and overwhelms the music from the restaurant.  The place needs a face lift and reorganization of the spaces to make it feel fresher and more welcoming.

data.title: Good Food, Lousy Service, Overpriced.
data.text:
I've been coming here on and off for more than 10 years. Here is what I've concluded based on my many different experiences. The food can be good, depending on what you order. They do make a mean Cadillac margarita (You won't need to order two because they make it strong). You're going to wait and the service will be anywhere from terrible to barely ok.
I would have rated Pepitos poor but the Cadillac margarita pushed the rating to average.

data.title: Always good
data.text: You can almost always get a table and the carne asada taco's are the best I have ever had.  The rice and beans are also some of my very favorite.  The place is old and the décor is dated but you will not be disappointed.  Service is excellent and the fried ice cream is sure to make it a perfect meal.

data.title: The food, service, and atmosphere was very nice
data.text: The food, service, and atmosphere was very nice.  This was our first visit and were pleasantly surprised.  We stopped for dinner, around 5pm on a Saturday evening.  We and one other couple were the only customers, my first thought was there had to be a reason why business was so slow.  By the time we had ordered and our food arrived the restaurant was nearly half full.  At first I thought the menu was pretty pricey, but after eating we quickly decided that it was worth every penny.  The quantity and quality of the meals exceeded my expectations.  It was unusually cool the evening we were there, but they do have a nice outdoor dining area and bar in back of the main restaurant.  We will return at our next opportunity.

data.title: GOOD CHOICE
data.text: Always enjoy eating here as the food has always been great.  Real Mexican atmosphere.  I'm pretty partial the the chicken burritos and chile verde but my daughters really enjoy the seafood and enchiladas.
